Please join us on Friday, June 26, 2020 after the online graduation ceremony to celebrate the accomplishments of our Class of 2020!

Seniors should arrive to the LCS staff parking lot in pre-decorated vehicles by 7:45 p.m. Cars should be decorated in black and orange at home and have the senior's name on the passenger side. We are asking seniors to wear their cap and gown and have a family member drive so each senior can enjoy their moment and not be distracted.

We invite family and community members to join in the celebration. Please line Main Street with signs and noise-makers to cheer the Class of 2020 as they pass by. Remember to demonstrate proper social distancing or wear a mask if you cannot physically stay 6 feet apart.

The parade will begin at 8:00 p.m. and will be led by Lyndonville's School Resource Officer. Parade participants are encouraged to tune their radios to 88.90 FM for a farewell address from school officials prior to parade departure.

We look forward to celebrating with all of you on June 26!

We invite family and community members to join in the celebration. Please line Main Street with signs and noise-makers to cheer the Class of 2020 as they pass by. Remember to demonstrate proper social distancing or wear a mask if you cannot physically stay 6 feet apart.

The parade will begin at 8:00 p.m. and will be led by Lyndonville's School Resource Officer. Parade participants are encouraged to tune their radios to 88.90 FM for a farewell address from school officials prior to parade departure.

We look forward to celebrating with all of you on June 26!

post_text: After extensive consultation with student leaders, class advisors, and our vendors, the difficult decision has been made to cancel the junior/senior prom. Originally scheduled for June, a tentative July date had been set. However, our venue has been unable to provide adequate assurances about group size limitations or restrictions for the event. Further, currently projected numbers for students interested in attending are well below minimum requirements for a cost-effective, affordable event. Combined with concerns regarding formalwear, student leaders and the majority of students expressed a strong preference for cancelling the prom in favor of planning an event for 2021 that will be better aligned with their hopes and expectations. We look forward to planning a memorable event, likely in spring of 2021.

I am proud of our students, faculty, staff and community. More challenging times are ahead of us and I look forward to our continued partnership.

Thank you.

Jason Smith, Superintendent of Schools
